item.title: LOTUS overview
item.description: This article gives an overview of the LOTUS batch computing cluster which is part of JASMIN. It covers: What LOTUS is and what it can be used for Where LOTUS can be accessed from What is LOTUS   LOTUS is not, in itself, a High-Performance Computing (HPC) facility, but provides the batch and parallel processing component of the JASMIN data- intensive scientific analysis environment.

item.title: Slurm scheduler overview
item.description: What is a Job Scheduler?   A job or batch scheduler, is a tool that manages how user jobs are queued and run on a set of compute resources.

item.title: Slurm status
item.description: The JASMIN dashboard includes an overview of: LOTUS queues/partitions status, including the number of running/completed/pending jobs and further information about the usage of the LOTUS and ORCHID clusters.

item.title: How to monitor Slurm jobs
item.description: Job information   Information on all running and pending batch jobs managed by Slurm can be obtained from the Slurm command squeue.

item.title: Example Job 2: Calculating MD5 Checksums on many files
item.description: This page records some early CEDA usage of the LOTUS cluster for various relatively simple tasks. Others may wish to use these examples as a starting point for developing their own workflows on LOTUS.

item.title: How to submit a job
item.description: This article explains how to submit a batch job to the new scheduler Slurm. What is a batch job?   A batch job is controlled by a script written by the user who submits the job to the batch system Slurm.

item.title: How to submit an MPI parallel job
item.description: This article explains the submission of an MPI parallel job to Slurm/ LOTUS. What is an MPI parallel job?   An MPI parallel job runs on more than one core and more than one host using the Message Passing Interface (MPI) library for communication between all cores.

item.title: LOTUS cluster specification
item.description: Current cluster specification   LOTUS is a cluster of over 300 nodes/hosts and 19000 CPU cores. A node/host is an individual computer in the cluster with more than 1 processor.

item.title: Slurm quick reference
item.description: Slurm Scheduler   Slurm  is the job scheduler deployed on JASMIN. It allows users to submit, monitor, and control jobs on the LOTUS (CPU) and ORCHID (GPU) clusters.
